io.appium.droiddriver.scroll

Class SentinelStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.appium.droiddriver.scroll.SentinelStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScrollStepStrategy
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicSentinelStrategy, StaticSentinelStrategy

    public abstract class SentinelStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements ScrollStepStrategy
    A ScrollStepStrategy that determines whether scrolling is possible based on a sentinel.

    • Field Detail

      • FIRST_CHILD_GETTER

        public static final SentinelStrategy.Getter FIRST_CHILD_GETTER
        Returns the first child as the sentinel.

      • LAST_CHILD_GETTER

        public static final SentinelStrategy.Getter LAST_CHILD_GETTER
        Returns the last child as the sentinel.

      • SECOND_LAST_CHILD_GETTER

        public static final SentinelStrategy.Getter SECOND_LAST_CHILD_GETTER
        Returns the second last child as the sentinel. Useful when the activity always shows the last child as an anchor (for example a footer).

        Sometimes uiautomatorviewer may not show the anchor as the last child, due to the reordering by layout described in UiElement.getChildren(io.appium.droiddriver.finders.Predicate<? super io.appium.droiddriver.UiElement>). This is not a problem with UiAutomationDriver because it sees the same as uiautomatorviewer does, but could be a problem with InstrumentationDriver.

      • SECOND_CHILD_GETTER

        public static final SentinelStrategy.Getter SECOND_CHILD_GETTER
        Returns the second child as the sentinel. Useful when the activity shows a fixed first child.

      • beginScrolling

        public void beginScrolling(DroidDriver driver,
                           Finder containerFinder,
                           Finder itemFinder,
                           Direction.PhysicalDirection direction)
        Description copied from interface: ScrollStepStrategy
        Called only if this step is at the beginning of a series of scroll steps with regard to the given arguments.
        Specified by:
        beginScrolling in interface ScrollStepStrategy
        Parameters:
        driver - a DroidDriver instance
        containerFinder - Finder for the container that can scroll, for instance a ListView
        itemFinder - Finder for the desired item; relative to containerFinder
        direction - specifies where the view port will move instead of the finger

      • doScroll

        public void doScroll(UiElement container,
                     Direction.PhysicalDirection direction)
        Description copied from interface: ScrollStepStrategy
        Performs the scroll action on container. Subclasses can override this to customize the scroll action, for example, to adjust the scroll margins.
        Specified by:
        doScroll in interface ScrollStepStrategy
        Parameters:
        container - the container that can scroll
        direction - specifies where the view port will move instead of the finger
